tool_description: Gets a screenshot from a webpage. Simply indicate the webpage url, and our API will do the rest. You can also indicate various parameters such as width, height, allocated time, and mobile view settings. Also handles Lazy Loading...
name: URL To Screenshot
title: URL To Screenshot

api_list.name: Get screenshot
api_list.description: Get a screenshot from a webpage url.

optional_parameters.name: height
optional_parameters.description: Height of the screenshot in pixels. If you want to take a full screenshot, set this parameter to -1. Maximum value: 10000.

optional_parameters.name: mobile
optional_parameters.description: Should we emulate a mobile device?

optional_parameters.name: allocated_time
optional_parameters.description: Time allocated to load the webpage, in seconds. Maximum value: 10.0.

optional_parameters.name: width
optional_parameters.description: Width of the screenshot in pixels. Maximum value: 2048.

optional_parameters.name: base64
optional_parameters.description: If 0, the API returns a PNG image. If 1, the API returns the image encoded in base 64 format (in that case, it might be a good idea to change the accept header to \"text/html\").
